title: Longest Subarray with Ones after Replacement
description: Given an array containing 0s and 1s, if you are allowed to replace no more than 'k' 0s with 1s, find the length of the longest contiguous subarray having all 1s.
aim: Demonstrate variable-size sliding window with ones counting; expand when zeros â‰¤ k and contract when zeros > k to find longest subarray of 1s after replacements.

examples.explanation: Replace the '0' at index 5 and 8 to have the longest contiguous subarray of 1s having length 6.
Replace the '0' at index 6, 9, and 10 to have the longest contiguous subarray of 1s having length 9.

steps.description: Initialize variables. We'll track the count of 1s in our window to know how many zeros we can replace.
steps.jarvisMessage: Welcome! We'll use a sliding window to find the longest subarray of 1s by replacing at most k=2 zeros. We'll track onesCount to know how many zeros we can replace.
steps.codeBotMessage: We'll expand the window when (windowSize - onesCount) â‰¤ k and contract when it exceeds k. This ensures we stay within our replacement limit.

steps.description: Expand: add 0. onesCount=0. Window size=1, zeros=1 â‰¤ k=2. maxLength=1.
steps.jarvisMessage: Added 0. We have 0 ones so far, so onesCount=0. Window size=1, zeros=1-0=1 â‰¤ k=2. We can replace this zero to make it 1. Update maxLength to 1.
steps.codeBotMessage: Window [0] is valid. Zeros = windowSize - onesCount = 1 - 0 = 1 â‰¤ k (2). We can replace this zero.

steps.description: Expand: add 1. onesCount=1. Window size=2, zeros=1 â‰¤ k=2. maxLength=2.
steps.jarvisMessage: Added 1. Now onesCount=1. Window size=2, zeros=2-1=1 â‰¤ k=2. We can replace 1 zero to make it 1. Update maxLength to 2.
steps.codeBotMessage: Window [0,1] is valid. Zeros = 2 - 1 = 1 â‰¤ k (2). We can replace 1 zero.

steps.description: Expand: add 0. onesCount=2. Window size=4, zeros=2 â‰¤ k=2. maxLength=4.

steps.codeBotMessage: Window [0,1,1,0] is valid. Zeros = 4 - 2 = 2 â‰¤ k (2). We can replace both zeros.

steps.description: Expand: add 0. onesCount=2. Window size=5, zeros=3 > k=2. Contract from left until zeros â‰¤ k.
steps.jarvisMessage: Added 0 but now we have 3 zeros (5-2=3 > k=2). We must contract from the left until we're back to â‰¤2 zeros. We removed the first 0, now window has 2 zeros.
steps.codeBotMessage: We contracted until zeros â‰¤ k. Now window has 4-2=2 zeros, which equals k=2.

steps.description: Continue contracting: remove 1. onesCount=1. Window size=3, zeros=2 â‰¤ k=2.
steps.jarvisMessage: Removed 1. Now onesCount=1. Window size=3, zeros=3-1=2 â‰¤ k=2. Window is now valid again.
steps.codeBotMessage: Window [1,0,0] is valid. Zeros = 3 - 1 = 2 â‰¤ k (2).
steps.codeSnippet: // Now valid: onesCount = 1; zeros = 2 â‰¤ k = 2

steps.description: Expand: add 0. onesCount=1. Window size=4, zeros=3 > k=2. Contract from left until zeros â‰¤ k.
steps.jarvisMessage: Added 0 but now we have 3 zeros (4-1=3 > k=2). We must contract from the left. Removed 1, now onesCount=0. Window has 3-0=3 zeros, still > k=2.
steps.codeBotMessage: Window [0,0,0] has 3 zeros > k (2), so we need to contract more.

steps.description: Continue contracting: remove 0. onesCount=0. Window size=2, zeros=2 â‰¤ k=2.
steps.jarvisMessage: Removed another 0. Now onesCount=0. Window size=2, zeros=2-0=2 â‰¤ k=2. Window is now valid again.
steps.codeBotMessage: Window [0,0] is valid. Zeros = 2 - 0 = 2 â‰¤ k (2).
